alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, south central Pender and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Castle Hayne, or 11 miles north of Wilmington, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Wrightsville Beach, Johnny Mercer Pier, Rich Inlet, Figure Eight Island, Hampstead, Bishop, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Castle Hayne, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Phoenix, Scotts Hill, Ogden, Mayfaire, Wrightsboro and Batarora. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 409 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 39 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
